Title: The Hunger Games
Description: In a post-apocalyptic North America, the ruling Capitol selects a boy and a girl from each of the twelve districts to fight to the death in the annual Hunger Games.
In a totalitarian society, a man named Winston Smith rebels against the oppressive regime and falls in love with a fellow rebel, leading to devastating consequences.

Title: The Great Gatsby
Description: Set in the Roaring Twenties, this novel tells the story of Jay Gatsby, a mysterious and wealthy man, and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

Title: The Hobbit
Description: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, is recruited by the wizard Gandalf to join a group of dwarves on a quest to reclaim their treasure from the dragon Smaug.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Description: In a small town in Alabama during the 1930s, a black man is falsely accused of a crime, and a young girl named Scout Finch learns about racism and injustice.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Description: Holden Caulfield, a teenager struggling with his own depression and disillusionment with society, embarks on a journey through New York City.
